Text:
Hi there, this is Badway. I'm thrilled to release my new map. The core gameplay of this map revolves around Water and Dream Refill, along with Move Block and Zip Mover,spanning a total of around 25 rooms. Experimenting with the combinations of these entities during mapping was an absolute delight for me, and I sincerely hope you enjoy this map.
Difficulty:from Intermediate to Advanced. It's techless or low-tech(dream jumps, dream grabs and a few launch boost).
Music used:
Erik Satie - Gnossiennes No. 1 (Pascal Rogé, 1983 Kingsway Hall Recording)
Name: Flood After the Plague
Author: BadwayBear

Text:
I wrapped up the main part of this map about a month ago, yet due to my limited level design experience, I spent a great deal of time tweaking it afterward.Admittedly, this map is far from excellent, but I’ve decided not to pour any more time into it. This map features around 45 rooms in total, from Intermediate to Advanced.
Hope you enjoy it!
Music used:
Throbbing Gristle - Beachy Head
Name: Fool's Summit
Author: BadwayBear

Text:
62 million places, featuring a chance to see one of 40 unique snails

every asset is created from my own photos
Name: someplace
Author: AuroraDrywall

Text:
Crossover Collab is a big Celeste mod where each map has at least the size of a vanilla map, featuring:

  • 20+ maps (+extras) spread across a wide range of difficulties
  • 1000+ playable rooms
  • Hundreds of custom entities and cutscenes
  • 200+ collectables


Madeline sets off to play videogames in her own computer.

Crossover Collab was made with the help of 100+ people over the span of three years, with big contributions from ~40 members.

Discover new games and rediscover games you already played from a Celeste perspective.
Explore over a hundred hand-crafted environments.
Face challenges from casual platforming to mind-melting puzzles.

Crossover Collab is divided into 5 difficulties within a single lobby from which you can access its maps. Each map teaches you all the new mechanics you'll need to use, with descriptions or playbacks. The two hardest maps come with their own gyms, showcasing the techs required in them.

Thank you to everyone involved in this enormous project, and we hope you enjoy it!

You can join the official Crossover Collab Community server for questions, bug reports, feedback and exchanging with other players.

FAQ
  • Do I need to own Celeste in order to play this?
    • Yes. Crossover Collab is an add-on fan-made mod for Celeste, not a standalone product. Note that mods do not work for Microsoft Store copies of the game!
  • Can I play this on my Switch or other console?
    • Unfortunately, no. Crossover Collab requires the Everest mod loader, which is desktop only. However, it is playable on the Steam Deck, in desktop mode.
  • Is there any additional content?
    • Feel free to replay maps that you enjoyed after you clear them for the first time. Who knows? Maybe you will discover something new!
    • Certain files in BerryOS (Madeline's computer) are unlocked under certain conditions.
  • I feel it will be too difficult for me. Can I still experience the visuals and music of the harder levels without grinding them for dozens of hours?
    • Yes. Celeste’s Assist Options are compatible with Crossover Collab, so you can adjust the difficulty to suit your preferences. While it is recommended to have completed at least the main story of Celeste, you can directly dive in the easiest maps.
    • Most of the maps expect you to be familiar with several techs, especially at middle-high difficulties, but all new mechanics are taught.
    • If you need additional info about generic movement and techs, you can visit the Gyms in Strawberry Jam/Spring Collab/other mods.
  • I’ve already played Strawberry Jam, will the difficulty scale be the same?
    • While the general difficulty categories of Crossover Collab are similar to Strawberry Jam, the maps may not follow the exact same difficulty boundaries as you’re used to. Certain optional secrets may be more than one star above the rest of the difficulty of the map.
  • So many games! Where should I start?
    •  Every map has colored stars that correspond to its difficulty (map completion with all main collectables, excluding secrets), from half star (easiest map) to beyond 5 stars (hardest map). These stars are found on the title banners in the Map Launchers. If you're new to a certain difficulty or modding in general, we recommend trying out maps marked green on their meters first for a smoother experience.
  • Help! The installation process didn’t work/my game crashed/I’m having other technical difficulties:
    • If you’re having trouble installing Everest or Crossover Collab, please double-check the installation instructions and make sure you didn’t skip a step or download the wrong version of Everest for your system.
    • If you’re getting the in-game error “Mods failed to load”, please navigate to the Mod Options menu and select “install missing dependencies”.
    • If your game crashes, an error log will pop up. Try disabling all mods besides Crossover Collab, its dependencies, and any cosmetic or quality of life mods you would like to use.
    • If the problem persists after trying these steps, join the official Celeste Discord server and post the issue in the #modding_help channel. If the issue is specific to the mod, you can also ask in the Crossover Collab Community server.
Name: Crossover Collab
Author: CrossoverCollab

Text:
So...I haven't released a map in quite a while, so I decided to make a simple and wholesome jaunt. Plus, I have Kirby on the mind again with Air Riders releasing tomorrow. Cotton Candy Constellations is a 6 room Intermediate map featuring red bubbles and loop blocks (the ones from Loopy Lagoon in SJ)

Music is Dreaming of Clouds from Kirby's Return to Dreamland Deluxe
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GihWh0MEFp0
Name: Cotton Candy Constellations
Author: Quinnigan

Text:
make your own custom subway sandwich, featuring 18 unique ingredients and 2 slices of bread

please ping me with your creations on discord @aurorameow!

all map assets are created from my own photos
i made the tilesets by taking photos of every ingredient at a subway

if you experience performance issues try disabling other mods, this map can run poorly with too many enabled.
Name: Subway
Author: AuroraDrywall

Description: A peaceful castle beyond the clouds
Text:
Welcome to Night's Crown of Flowers! 

This map is the first of a 4 map campaign that will be fully releasing next year, comprising of beginner and intermediate maps all using some of my favorite tracks from Genshin Impact. Does this count as music translation? probably!

This map contains 6 rooms of beginner/low intermediate gameplay using aero blocks, red boosters and dream refills, for tech you only need to know dream grabs (taught in 2c) and how to super from a booster.

The map's song is Night's Crown of Flowers



If you find any issues or just want to talk to me about the map, feel free to ping me in celestecord (@chelito0607) or dm me! I love hearing people's thoughts about my work.
Name: Night's Crown of Flowers
Author: Chelito0607

Description: The Secret Ingredient is the friends we have made along the way.
Text:
"We just need one more ingredient for this soup to taste really good, what should we add?"

Secret Ingredient Contest is all about mapping with a given palette, but you can add a few of your own things in the mix to give it a unique spin!
Will you add a triple dash refill or do you rather fancy a Kevin? It's all up to you!

The Secret Ingredient Lobby features 28 maps ranging from Beginner to Expert in a lobby format!

You can find the judging sheet here.
Name: Secret Ingredient Contest
Author: Crispybag

Description: A cute adventure intended for all skill levels
Text:
Daybreak is a 30+ room Beginner map created by myself and Crispybag, brimming with cute content and is sure to be a relaxing experience for all skill levels! There are 20 berries to collect, plus several hidden secrets! I know I say this often but this was absolutely some of the most fun I've had designing for this game, and getting the chance to work alongside Crispybag was delightful. 

The music used is PENCIL THOUGHT by LudoWic, if you end up streaming the map, or had a great time and want to let us know, please ping us @abuffzucchini & @crispybag!! We'd love to hear your thoughts :) Have fun!
Name: Daybreak
Author: ABuffZucchini

Text:
A skin mod that aims to replace Madeline with Mario from the Super Mario Franchise!

Making use of Skin Mod Helper Plus, this mod contains:
  • A reskin of Madeline’s player animations with Mario!
  • A toggeable texture pack that replaces Strawberries with Power Stars!
  • Additional Sprite Replacements for Badeline, extra moves & More!!

Make sure to turn on the extra texture packs by going to General Skins in the Mod Settings!!



This was a little passion project I spent about 2-3 weeks on since I've wanted a Mario over Madeline replacement for ages, I hopefully plan to update it more in the future to include some sprites for cutscenes and additional mods but I hope you like what I have currently : ]

Thanks for checking out the mod!! Enjoy ^^
~ Ash
Name: Super Mario over Madeline
Author: ashmosphere

Text:
short comfy beginner map featuring ~9 main rooms, 2 berries, and a semi-but-not-really-unique custom mechanic, intended to be for aon's birthday (but very late because     oops im super slow at mapping apparently weh)

(i spent probably way too much time on thiss and i'm not sure how well this succeeds at being a "birthday map" in terms of being designed around the stuff u like  etc      it's very much in my current comfort zone / style so i could feel like i trusted myself to even have a chance of finishing Anything at all, but past those doubts i'm still quite happy with how this map turned out i thinkk. hopefully it's enjoyable enough :peaceline:)
Name: amber leaf bluffs
Author: earthwise

Text:
Probably a beginner map that I made to practice designing easy maps. The deco is not that good but I tried to make it looks better as I can.
This map contains about 40 short rooms, some berries and a cassette, but there's no B-side by far.
The Rocky Grass tileset is made by Flagpole1up.
Thanks to sssxxxx, slugcat and nanix for playtesting the map and giving me suggestions.
The musics used in this map are 'I am broken already' by Aniket and 'a moment we will never see' by Rooh / anębu.
Ultimately, if you have any questions pls leave a comment here and I'll try to solve it. Hope you have a great time playing this map!
Name: Nyx
Author: ssat

Description: Madeline finds herself amidst a dystopian world, where the line that divides dream and reality is all but an illusion...
Text:
This map's original mechanics were made for another collab, which DIED a tragic death in a classic tale of "oh shit college workload ain't fucking around." So after the announcement was made, I took the mechanics, gave the entire map a massive gameplay and aesthetical overhaul, and now it's releasing as a standalone. Wow! Go me!

All the tech required in this map is taught in vanilla Celeste—while I wouldn't recommend you play this immediately after beating Farewell, you also won't be blocked by a hard game knowledge check. So hey, you call the shots :)

Some other details:
  • Difficulty covers the range of green to red Advanced I think, towards the end it most definitely ventures into low Expert territory. Arguably. I don't make difficulty creep, I just embrace it
  • Around 30 gameplay rooms where you dash and jump in various directions
  • 6 red fruits of the straw variety
  • A bit of worldbuilding and a somewhat impressionistic story
  • 15 minutes of completely original music!!!

Special thanks to Thegur90, who made all of the OST for this map, and also offered good feedback and ideas on musical direction. Can't thank you enough, the map seriously wouldn't be the same without your contribution <3  Please go support and listen to it here!

For any bugs, feedback, or just comments, feel free to ping/DM @ricky06 on Discord!
Name: City of Broken Dreams
Author: ricky06

Description: A delve into the mind of a creative
Text:
Welcome to the gallery.

This map is my submission to Esoterica Contest, a heavily vibes-based contest where gameplay is not the main focus.

As part of the contest guidelines, two quotes in particular stood out to me:

"Empty the deepest recesses of your mapping brain into lönn"

and

"just make art"

For this map, I essentially took that guidance as literally as I could and created a gallery of art pieces through the medium of Celeste. The map doesn't have traditional gameplay and should be accessible to all. I also chose to take on the challenge of using zero custom code for this map. All of the pieces in this map are created using ready available tools from existing helpers. The amount of toys we have as mappers is insane thanks to all of the talented creators in the community.

NOTE: This map uses various visual effects that may look a bit strange if you have Photosensitive Mode enabled. For the intended experience, please play with Photosensitive Mode OFF if it is safe for you to do so.

Please let me know what you think. If you have any feedback you'd like to share, feel free to reach out to me on Discord.

I hope you enjoy!

- Spooooky

Music Credits:

The Gallery:
Circles - Berlinist

Tranquility:
A Way Home - John Connearn

Perspective:
Blue City (In Game) - Upright T-Rex Music

Nostalgia:
fish in the pool - yeule

Reflection:
La Cathédrale Engloutie - sora

Illusion:
Jezevec - Tomáš Dvořák

Comparison:
Sentient Forest - Nathan de Broize-King

Indecision:
Rain - Walter Wanderley

Thoughts:
Melancholia XII - William Basinski

Isolation:
Bound By Fate - TPR
Thunder Rain Ocean - Natural Sounds Selections

Overwhelm:
Leviathan - Atrium Carceri

Legacy:
Faltering Prayer (Starry Sky) - Keigo Hoashi, Keiichi Okabe
Name: Aesthetica
Author: Spooooky

Name: Bernadette
Author: ricky06

Description: A collaboration involving 350+ people to commemorate Celeste
Text:
Welcome to the Jam!

Strawberry Jam is the largest Celeste mod to date, featuring:

  • 111 maps spread across 5 difficulties
  • 1500+ playable rooms
  • 9 hours of original music
  • 250+ strawberries
  • Stickers!


Madeline sets off to find many, many more strawberries.

Strawberry Jam was made with the help of 350+ community members over the span of two years.

Learn and discover new skills and mechanics.
Explore over a hundred hand-crafted environments.
Face challenges from casual platforming to mind-melting puzzles.
Jam out to an original soundtrack, ranging from smooth jazz to dubstep, chiptune to classical, and more!

Strawberry Jam is divided into 5 difficulties, each with a lobby from which you can access its maps and its gym. Each gym teaches you all the tips and techniques you'll need to succeed, with detailed text descriptions and video playbacks.

The original soundtrack to Strawberry Jam is available for download on Bandcamp. The five-album collection is priced as pay what you want, with all money earned from sales being donated to Trans Lifeline. The music will also be available on all major streaming platforms a few weeks after release.

Thank you to everyone involved in this enormous project, and we hope you enjoy it!



Installation Instructions


FAQ
  • Do I need to own Celeste in order to play this?
    • Yes. Strawberry Jam is an add-on mod for Celeste, not a standalone product.
  • Can I play this on my Switch or other console?
    • Unfortunately, no. Strawberry Jam requires the Everest mod loader, which is desktop only. However, it is playable on the Steam Deck, in desktop mode.
  • Is this an official release or DLC for Celeste?
    • No. Strawberry Jam is a fan-made modding project.
  • I feel it will be too difficult for me. Can I still experience the visuals and music of the harder levels without grinding them for dozens of hours?
    • Yes. Celeste’s Assist Options are fully compatible with Strawberry Jam, so you can adjust the difficulty to suit your preferences. Additionally, several maps in the Beginner Lobby don’t get any more difficult than Celeste’s Summit chapter, so you don’t need to have completed the B-Sides or Farewell to dive in.
  • I’ve already played Spring Collab, will the difficulty scale be the same?
    • While the general structure of Strawberry Jam is very similar to Spring Collab, each lobby may not follow the exact same difficulty boundaries as you’re used to.
  • So many maps! Where should I start?
    •  Every map has a meter that corresponds to its difficulty within the lobby, from green (easier) to red (harder). These meters are found on the title banners of the map, and in the journal. If you're new to a certain difficulty or modding in general, we recommend trying out maps marked green on their meters first for a smoother experience.
  • Help! The installation process didn’t work/my game crashed/I’m having other technical difficulties:
    • If you’re having trouble installing Everest or Strawberry Jam, please double-check the installation instructions and make sure you didn’t skip a step or download the wrong version of Everest for your system.
    • If you’re getting the in-game error “Mods failed to load”, please navigate to the Mod Options menu and select “install missing dependencies”.
    • If your game crashes, an error log will pop up. If the phrase “Out of memory exception” appears at the top of the log, you likely have too many content mods enabled. Try disabling all mods besides Strawberry Jam, its dependencies, and any cosmetic or quality of life mods you would like to use.
    • If the problem persists after trying these steps, please join the official Celeste Discord server and post the issue in the #modding_help channel.
Name: Strawberry Jam Collab
Author: Strawberry Jam Collab Team

Description: A collaboration involving 100+ people to commemorate Celeste
Text:
The 2020 Celeste Spring Collab is a project that has been in the making for over 8 months with 100+ people involved. After waiting patiently for so long, we're proud to present you the final product!

The Spring Collab Has:

  • 5 Chapters Each with a Different Level of Difficulty
  • 80+ Maps
  • 300+ Rooms
  • 1500+ Hours of Playtesting
  • 175+ Strawberries
  • 40+ New Music Tracks 
  • Dozens of New Custom Mechanics
  • Many, Many New Sprites
  • Built-in Speedrun Times

The Spring Collab has 5 lobbies for you to explore, loaded with maps made by the community. The difficulty of the maps spans from early Vanilla content to some of the hardest Celeste maps that exist, providing enjoyable content for everyone.

Once a Map is beaten, Silver Berries and Speed Berries will spawn in its first room. Silver Berries will require you to reach the end of the map to be collected, while Speed Berries will time how fast you get through the map, and then give you a ranking! (To unlock all berries at the start, unlock Cheat Mode in the vanilla Prologue chapter.)

Thank you everyone who participated in the development of this project, and thank you everyone for playing the collab!

Because of how the lobbies were developed, using the Debug Tools or any unintended mod functionality or debug commands may break the lobbies.

The Spring Collab 2020 Audio file is a required dependency for the mod, and it also goes in the Mods folder like any other dependency. The Everest auto downloader will do this for you.
The collab soundtrack is streamable on all major streaming platforms. The Majority of proceeds from OST sales go to benefit Trans Lifeline. You can buy the album here. The remainder of the proceeds will go to support the creator of Everest (The program that made this all possible).

If you'd like to make a donation directly, use the donation button or this link.

iamdadbod is in the process of making playthrough videos for every single map in this pack. The playlist of all releases can be found by clicking this link or just going to iamdadbod's channel. There are also playlists for each difficulty chapter. This link has a list of all available videos with additional information including direct links to specific videos. New videos are being released daily so check back often!


This mod includes Randomizer support: by installing Spring Collab and the Randomizer mod, you will be able to play randomized maps including rooms from the collab. More information and credits here.
For issues or suggestions about the randomizer config, reach out to Bigkahuna#0491 on Discord or ping him in the #randomizer channel on the Celeste Discord. Please include randomizer version, seed, and settings in any bug reports.
Name: The 2020 Celeste Spring Community Collab
Author: Spring Collab 2020 Team

Description: Maddie goes on a journey through the mind & memories of one that are not her own.
Text:
Hi thanks for playing this map! this was created by marshall h (marshall#9752 on discord)

I do this for fun and personal development, but I aspire to do game development / music for a living someday, and I'd definitely appreciate support. You can purchase the soundtrack for this Mod on Bandcamp. If you'd like to listen to it for free though, find it on Soundcloud.

The featured artwork was made by the amazing Fuwamo, go support them and their work!

MAIN MAP INFO
---------
Maddie goes on a journey through the mind & memories of one that are not her own.  An impressionistic map that should be suitably challenging for advanced players of Celeste.

Over 100 rooms & over 30 berries
Lots of ~~secrets~~
45+ minute OST & custom SFX

Difficulty: Around or perhaps slightly more difficult than Farewell. Some berries are more difficult than Farewell. If you can beat the C-Sides and Farewell you probably will be able to get through this. I would recommend being comfortable / practiced with wallbounces and wavedashes before playing this map, as you'll likely find it less frustrating.

Tech required: Wallbounces, wavedashing, hypers, etc. Nothing that you haven't had to do in Farewell or the C-sides. Neutrals are disabled. No advanced tech beyond that of the C-Side & Farewell is required for full completion

SEASONSIDES
------------
Aka Glyph B-sides, but four of them. Added as individual chapters following the main map.
~95 rooms across the new chapters
No berries, no secrets in these, just level.
Difficulty: around same difficulty or slightly harder than  the main experience. I didn't really intend to make harder maps, just wanted to explore some of the concepts of the main chapter further here.
Tech required: Same as main map. Neutrals are still disabled. 

VOID-SIDE (ALL SEASONS MIX)
-----------
The void-side now has a cassette at the conclusion of the chapter which unlocks a new level. It's just more void, if you wanted more of that style gameplay you might enjoy these rooms.
~30 rooms
No berries, though a golden berry challenge does exist.
Difficulty: Around the same as the other void rooms. Hope you enjoy!
Tech required: Same as main map. Neutrals are still disabled. 

DEPENDENCIES
-----------
Frost Helper (https://gamebanana.com/gamefiles/9201)
Extended Variants Mode (https://gamebanana.com/gamefiles/9486)
Glyph Audio (https://gamebanana.com/gamefiles/11936) 

DISCLAIMERS
------------
- Neutrals are force disabled via extended variants. I did this because I think this map in particular plays better without them. I recognize that this Is controversial, especially for very experienced players. But all I can ask is that you approach the map with an open mind!
- Debug mode will probably break things, use at your own peril
- Photosensitive mode enabled might make the transitions between rooms a little funky looking but that's okay. I recommend keeping photosensitivity mode disabled if you do not require the feature and it is safe for you to do so.
- Yes, if it isn't obvious already, I love Fez and Hyper Light Drifter, and I draw a lot of inspiration from those games and music.

CONTACT
---------------
I'm receptive to feedback if its actionable so do give me a shout if you find bugs or have any issues!
Reach out to me on discord if you'd like at marshall#9018
Or email me at mwhatters@gmail.com
If you want to use this music for anything please ask first!
cheers xoxo
Name: Glyph
Author: marshall h
